page.title: 16THE NATIONAL GRID
page.content: The{Electricity Board}sent two gentlemen to talk to us about their recent work in{Broughton Astley}.The transmission lines have been replaced. They are made of aluminium.This work is only carried out every quarter of a century.We will be thirty five when this happens again. The workmen can move along the lines in special trolleys.Nets prevent the wires from trailing on the roads. { Broughton Astley's}power comes from { Hinckley}via{Stoney Stanton}.It is transformed down t0 240 volts to use in homes and schools. We visited a local field to look at a pylon.We were interested to learn about the glass insulators which prevent electricity travelling down to earth via the steel pylon.
